revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software license | name = Do What The Fuck You Want To Public License | author = [[Sam Hocevar]] | version = 2 | copyright = Sam Hocevar | date = 2004 | OSI approved = No<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.opensource.org/minutes20090304|title=OSI Board Meeting Minutes, Wednesday, March 4, 2009}}</ref> | Debian approved = Yes | Free Software = Yes<ref name="fsf">{{cite web |url=http://www.fsf.org/licensing/licenses#WTFPL |title=Licenses - Free Software Foundation|publisher=Free Software Foundation }}</ref> | GPL compatible = Yes <ref name="fsf" /> | copyleft = No <ref name="fsf" /> | copyfree = Yes<ref>Certified [http://copyfree.org/licenses Copyfree Licenses]</ref> | linking = Yes }}
The '''WTFPL''' ('''Do What The Fuck You Want To Public License''') is an infrequently used, extremely [[permissive free software license]]. The original Version 1.0 license, released March 2000,<ref>[http://www.google.com/codesearch?hl=en&q=wtfpl+show:g4zb44bMtMQ:okSYrUiE3pk:V2KrzwlAdBI&sa=N&cd=80&ct=rc&cs_p=http://ftp.debian.org/debian/pool/main/n/nonlock/nonlock_1.7.orig.tar.gz&cs_f=nonlock-1.7.orig/COPYING.WTFPL March 2000 Version 1.0] <sup>[http://www.google.com/codesearch/p?hl=en#DWZnTKPZn18/COPYING.WTFPL&q=wtfpl%202000&sa=N&cd=1&ct=rc copy]</sup></ref> was written by Banlu Kemiyatorn who used it for [[Window Maker]] artwork.<ref>[http://freeware.sgi.com/Installable/WindowMaker-0.80.2.html Window Maker WTFPL]</ref> [[Sam Hocevar|Samuel âSamâ Hocevar]], a [[France|French]] [[programmer]] who was the [[Debian]] [[Debian Project Leader#Project leaders|project leader]] from 17 April 2007 to 16 April 2008, wrote version 2.0.<ref name="Hocevar, WTFPL, 2.0" >{{cite web |url=http://sam.zoy.org/wtfpl/ |title=WTFPL 2.0 |author=Sam Hocevar }}</ref> It allows for redistribution and modification of the software under any termsâlicensees are encouraged to âdo what the [[fuck]] [they] want toâ. The license was approved as a [[GNU General Public License|GPL]]-compatible free software license by the [[Free Software Foundation]].<ref name="fsf" />
== Terms == The text of the license<ref name="Hocevar, WTFPL, 2.0" />:
DO WHAT THE FUCK YOU WANT TO PUBLIC LICENSE Version 2, December 2004
Copyright (C) 2004 Sam Hocevar <sam@hocevar.net>
Everyone is permitted to copy and distribute verbatim or modified copies of this license document, and changing it is allowed as long as the name is changed.
DO WHAT THE FUCK YOU WANT TO PUBLIC LICENSE TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR COPYING, DISTRIBUTION AND MODIFICATION
0. You just DO WHAT THE FUCK YOU WANT TO.
== Uses == The WTFPL is rarely used, at least by name, but some software has been released. In addition, the license can be applied to artwork and written material as well.<ref name="Hocevar, WTFPL, 2.0" /> [[Freshmeat]], an index of [[free software]], includes a specific category for WTFPL software and artwork, containing 27 entries {{As of|2011|07|lc=on}},<ref>{{cite web |url=http://freshmeat.net/tags/wtfpl |publisher=freshmeat.net |title=Projects tagged "WTFPL" |accessdate=2011-07-19 }}</ref> of which two are authored by [[Sam Hocevar]], the author of the 2.0 license. Potlatch, the online editor of the [[OpenStreetMap]] project, is released under the WTFPL.
